title: Shap value doesn't match model output

labels.name: todo
labels.description: This issue had an outstanding action to take.

labels.name: help wanted
labels.description: Indicates that a maintainer wants help on an issue or pull request

body:
First off, thanks so much for shap! I love it. So I'm having an issue where the shap values are on a much different scale than my model output. I only come across this issue when I run lightgbm in random forest mode - when I use lightgbm in boosting mode or use sklearn random forest, shap works as expected. Here is a minimal reproducible example of my error.

code:
```
import lightgbm as lgb
import shap

# load JS visualization code to notebook
shap.initjs()

# load data
X, y = shap.datasets.boston()

# train lightgbm random forest
model = lgb.LGBMRegressor(boosting_type = 'rf', 
                          n_estimators = 500,
                          max_depth = 7,
                          num_leaves = 2**7,
                          subsample_freq = 1,
                          subsample = 0.6,
                          colsample_bytree = 0.5,
                          n_jobs = -1,
                          random_state = 123,
                          importance_type = 'gain',
                         )

model.fit(X, y)

# calculate shap values
explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(model)
shap_values = explainer.shap_values(X)

# visualize the first prediction's explanation
shap.force_plot(explainer.expected_value, shap_values[0,:], X.iloc[0,:])

# get the first prediction from the model
model.predict(X.iloc[0:1])
```
output:

visualizer's prediction is 14340.97
the model prediction is 28.68

Any help is appreciated as I much prefer lightgbm's implementation of random forest over sklearn's.

Thanks!

![shap_issue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7001021/60271906-c8190c80-98b8-11e9-9d89-ee37d51a31ea.png)
